author: USA TODAY
title: North Korea executions under Kim Jong Un
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email North Korea executions under Kim Jong Un North Korea's Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un has reportedly executed as many as 70 people since taking power in December 2011. That's about seven times as many as his father during the first years of his reign. That's about seven times as many as his father during the first years of his reign. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1XjKmMb Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 20 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs North Korea executions under Kim Jong Un George Petras , USA TODAY Published 7:27 p.m. ET Feb. 10, 2016 | Updated 1 hour ago Kim Jong Un (Photo: KNS, AFP/Getty Images) 242 CONNECT 20 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
North Korea's Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un has reportedly executed 70 people since taking power in 2011. That's about seven times as many as his father during the first years of his reign. Many were carried out as Kim consolidated power, but others were personal vendettas. While many names and details remain unknown, here are some of the executions Kim has ordered, compared to his father: 
Gen. Ri Yong-Gil | Army chief of staff Offense: Corruption Date of execution: February 2016 Method: Firing squad Offense: "Showed disloyalty to the leader" Date of execution: May 2015 Method: Anti-aircraft gun 
Gen. Pyon In Son | Head of army operations Charge: Corruption, failure to follow orders Date of execution: January 2015 Method: Firing squad 
Gen. Ri Pyong-Chol | C ommander of air force Offense: Unknown Date of execution: August 2014 Method: Unknown
